snippet: Vehicles would broadcast location and speed to other vehicles to cut down on accidents by alerting drivers.
abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration plans to require all new cars to broadcast their location, speed, direction and other data, and to receive similar data from other vehicles, to warn drivers of impending collisions; regulators caution any new rules will be years away.
lead_paragraph: Vehicles would broadcast location and speed to other vehicles to cut down on accidents by alerting drivers.
